meanings.definition: Convert or attempt to convert (someone) from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: She proselytized her friend to join her church.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries proselytized the villagers to follow their faith.
meanings.sent3: He proselytized his cat to prefer fish over chicken.
meanings.sent4: The salesman proselytized the benefits of the new product to the customers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher proselytized the importance of reading to her students.

meanings.definition: Advocate or promote (a belief or course of action).
meanings.sent1: The activist proselytized for environmental conservation.
meanings.sent2: She proselytized the benefits of exercise to her friends.
meanings.sent3: He proselytized for the use of purple as the new favorite color.
meanings.sent4: The coach proselytized the value of teamwork to the players.
meanings.sent5: The politician proselytized the need for better education in the community.
